resources.string: The University of Bradford received its Royal Charter in 1966, making it the 40th university to be created inBritain.
The University of Bradford has been rated by the Guardian among the top five universities in the UK for the effectiveness of its teaching and the value added to students.
In 2013, 92.5% of University of Bradford Computing graduates found employment or went on to further study within six months of graduating.
The Department of Computing was one of the first in the UK to run an MSc course in Computing back in 1967.
In 2014, Bradford was named curry capital of the year for the fourth year in a row.
